discourse_list.title: Potential new idea for the protocol fee switch - Introducing Perpetual Rewards

content.content: Hi All, I am developing a new idea called “perpetual rewards” that I feel could be useful to many high-transaction volume Web3 protocols. I would like to introduce it to the Uniswap community for feedback and viability. This idea focuses on how…   a protocol could further economically align itself with its users by making them the primary beneficiaries of the value generated by the protocol   a governance-controlled protocol treasury could effectively deploy funds generated by protocol activity in order to help their network grow.                   .                         .   If there is interest, I’d love feedback and guidance on how to advance this. Full disclosure, this is NOT advice of any kind (legal/financial). I’m not a lawyer nor has this been reviewed by a lawyer and it certainly should be before any decisions are made.   UniswapGovernanceIdea_1944×1266 106 KB
content.GPT-summary: The author of the post is introducing a new idea called "perpetual rewards" to the Uniswap community and is seeking feedback and guidance on how to advance it. The idea focuses on how a protocol could further economically align itself with its users by making them the primary beneficiaries of the value generated by the protocol. The author also provides a disclaimer that this is not legal or financial advice and has not been reviewed by a lawyer.
